intro: Haronga crenata, commonly known as the serrated haronga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Haronga crenata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
